intro: Senecio vulcanopichis, commonly known as the Galápagos groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio vulcanopichis plays a vital role in the local ecosystem, providing food and habitat for various endemic species.
